reviewText: The best Siter Skain game by a mile. Very balanced difficulty and mechanics while having much tighter pacing and level design. Stages tended to drag on in Kamui and RefleX but you never get that feeling here. Scoring system feels very natural and the sword attack (reminiscent of Radiant Silvergun) + special weapons are incredibly satisfying to use. The fully 3D graphics are understated but the game features excellent art direction and impressive effects in certain places. Music is an unabashed tribute to the iconic rocking themes of Hyakutaro Tsukumo from Technosoft fame. Highly recommended to anyone, not just genre fans. (I recommend disabling the shot + sword for special attack command, and the annoying pause when killing enemies with the sword that is enabled by default.)
voteText: 27 of 28 people (96%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Heck Yea! This is an awesome 2.5D shooter with a kicka$$ soundtrack that really gets you into the action.
The graphics do seem a little dated, but what this game offers in gameplay and fun factor will be more than enough to keep you playing and enjoying it. :)

Just like in similar shooters, you get your bullet spread and homing lasers but this time you have a freakin' awesome laser cannon that locks onto foes from all angles so you can knock them senseless if they try to be slick and sneak up behind you. :P But I have to say that the laser blade is what does it for me. :D It locks and attacks close range foes at all angles just like the laser cannon and its capable of slicing through most enemy fire. Its almost like a shield and weapon all in one. But it's strong point is when fighting tough foes and bosses and moving in with the laser blade and pounding them down to size! It's awesome!!! xD

This game plays smooth, looks great and is a lot of fun but don't be fooled. This game is not easy! You will find a very good challenge here even on Normal difficulty. Swarms of foes and enemy fire from all angles and crazy camera movements will sometimes make you dizzy trying to catch up to what is happening. LOL. xD

If you are a fan of shooter games, you should definitely try this one. You won't be disappointed. ^ ^
voteText: 13 of 16 people (81%) found this review helpful

reviewText: There’s a running duality to all of Siter’s games. KAMUI asks you to dance between twin layers while RefleX has you constantly switch between offense and defence to reflect projectiles back at your enemy. ALLTYNEX’s catch is figuring out whether you’re going to play safe and shoot down things from the edge of the screen or charge in swinging. Be brave, be good or be lucky and boss fights can last seconds as you position yourself in a manufactured safe-spot right in front of their face and hack away. There’s something so satisfying about watching an enemy fighter craft quadruple in size by firing robotic tentacles that latch massive frigates to its sides only to then get effortlessly slashed into scrap regardless. In finding yourself trapped in a corner and realising you can just slice the smaller bullets out of the air and squeeze through the projectile wall unscathed.\n\nFull Review // http://www.honestgamers.com/12447/pc/alltynex-second/review.html

reviewText: It is not easy to find modern shoot em ups that keep the quality and enjoyability that had those of the 16-bit era. I have played to many shoot em ups since then and I have found only a few worth playing. Of course Radiant Silvergun, Ikaruga, Gradius V and Gaiden and so on. Alltynex second is clearly worthplaying. It has good graphics, good music and smart gameplay that includes a silvergun-style sword.\n\nAs hapens with Ikaruga, it is a bit too short, but I strongly recommend it. By the way, I am enjoying very much Reflex, so I should say that the tales of alltynex package is a good choice.

Siter Skain made another ALLTYNEX game.

And it was very good.

I always worry when I see a beloved 2-D game jump to three dimensions.  After some time learning Second, this is still every bit an ALLTYNEX shoot-em-up.  My one wish would've been more original boss archetypes; most of these are reused from KAMUI and RefleX.  However, because it's a visual jump, I'll forgive it that.  The devs probably wanted to make the game play well first.  And with that, they surely succeeded.

10/10 Would shmup again.

A+
A short and free modern sidescroller with good graphics, fast-paced gameplay, and challenging but beatable gameplay.

+The entire game is about 20 minutes long, but there's a tremendous amount of replay value in trying for high score achievements.
+The difficulty progression is just right, with the easy first 5 minutes scaling up to a very high difficulty for the last few bosses.
+The blend of melee and range is excellent: it's really necessary to integrate both to do well.

-The only flawis that it's difficult to aim the auto-targetting melee in some fights.  The advanced craft's aiming functionality should have been combined into the basic craft to allow optional rotation.

Vertical and horizontal scrolling shoot' em up !

If you ever played raptor in old times or you played KAMUI then you will like this.

reviewText: I'm used to Shmup and Danmaku, and the first time I played ALLTYNEX Second, I couldn't pass the second level. I thought I was a big noob. Then... I discovered the Blade Mode. Well,  that was my fault, to not watching the tutorial and the input settings...\n\nNow, I'm getting used to it, and the Blade mode really adds something to the gameplay. You feel very powerful, slashing ships 10 times bigger than yours. You also eat bullets as if they were your cereals at breakfast. So tasty.

reviewText: SITER SKAIN continues to impress me. They've been making some awesome shoot-em-up games, and this is no exception. Utilizing two different weapon systems (your standard bullet spray and a blade system used to destroy enemy bullets and mid-sized enemies with ease), two different special attacks, a unique scoring system, decent graphics and a nice soundtrack make this one of the best, if not THE best shmup you can find on Steam. SITER SKAIN makes some awesome shmups, and I hope they continue making them.
Sweet fast paced shooter with great graphics. If like Raystorm on the Playstation this reminds me of it.
Great game, good graphics, good challenge, a real go-getter among shmups.

Did you enjoy the old PSX bullet hell shooter genre? Then this game might just be for you! Its fast, bright, loud, and hard, just like i remember them. A solid game for the genre, but sadly, it seems I'm just not as good at these as I used to be. Still, if this sort of thing sounds like your cup of tea, I say go for it!
I've never played a game like this, but I've seen similar ones before. All in all, this is a really fun game. I would recomend using a controller. I found that to make it easier personally.
I've never played a game like this, but I've seen similar ones before. All in all, this is a really fun game. I would recomend using a controller. I found that to make it easier personally.

What can I say that hasn't already been said about ALLTYNEX Second?
Honestly if you've arrived to this page you need to scroll back up and buy the game already!
All I can do is harp on the fact that this is a unique old school side scrolling shoot em' up that is borderline guilty pleasure addictive with a fantastic soundtrack and a unique gun system that combines standard bullets, lasers, and missiles with mounted blades!
The graphics are old-school cool 3D effects from the PS1 era.
The controls are intuitive and responsive with a simple keyboard layout.
The game is well balanced and challenging throughout without any dips within the difficulty which can plague a game of this genre.
It's a extremely fun and satisfying game worth whatever asking price is currently attached to it.
Just buy it already! You could of been playing it by now.

Verdict: 7/10 worth every penny.
Very cool doujin shmup. Your fighter can shoot , use wing blade to wipe off enemy bullets and shoot a big laser.

I love shmups! They're my genre of choice.

This one? Goooooood.
The music is outstanding, the controls are tight, enemies are... well, as varied as they are in shmups.

My single complaint (one that I'm sure will cease to be an issue once I play more) is that certain things that look like obstacles to avoid can be flown through while others a'blow you up. Minor quibble that'll get learned over time.

Do I recommend this? Resounding yes. If you like Raiden, you'll like this. If you like Cave's series of bullet hell games, you'll like this. There's something for everyone here, and did I mention the outstanding music? Mein Gott im Himmel.
Fairly generic bullet-hell game. While I'm fairly sure there's a story in it somewhere, I couldn't really find it. But hey, we've got lasers!
Easy to underestimate. Quite fun\n\nI looked at the graphics and they didn't look polished at all. However, once things start flying at you at high speed, everything looks fantastic.
Amazing. Done the right way. Very challenging, and awesome FR.\nPlay it. Now.
Great soundtrack, the first stage really gets you going. The beam sword makes this game a lot more innovative compared to other shmups. Definitely a must buy if you love the genre.

Did you like Raptor: Call of the Shadows, Tyrian, or any other vertically scrolling fancy-flying shooter? If not, you'll probably still love this one. And if you did? Well, even more so. Blasting and slashing one's way through enemy fleets and defenses using a well-rounded arsenal of four distinctive weapons divided between two tactically important flight modes, all but the most reluctant will learn to love this gem.

It's challenging, but fair. You'll need some reflexes and depth perception to enjoy it, true -but if you practice and try new things then odds are you'll do better and get farther each time, and the satisfaction of pulling off dashing ace piloting sequences through radiant cluster blossoms of fire and scrap is well worth the effort. Besides, what's the point of destroying an armada that isn't very likely to kill you and everyone you like if you don't?

Anyone who complains about the graphics needs to find something valid to complain about. This game is pretty to look at and runs super-smoothly. The story helped draw me in, and the sense of desperation it exhibits is palpable in the gameplay as well. Bonus points if you rattle off heroic pilot commentary while playing. In japanese, of course.

Oh, and don't let the 'second' in the title fool you -this is the first game in the trilogy, if I'm not mistaken...

Reminds me of the old school shoot em up games back in the arcade. Provides an interesting concept and distinguishes it well.
Pros: Shoot Em Up with an interesting plot.
Great Soundtrack and Sound.
Game is difficult but at the same time rewarding once you pass a hard area.
Controls work great
Cons: Graphics may be outdated but at the same time it is a fun game.
Overall: For the short time I played this game, I recommend it. Its fun, challenging and explosive. The soundtrack and gameplay its worth the price. P.S its a hard game, :) but practice makes perfect.

All I can do is harp on the fact that this is a unique old school side scrolling shoot em' up that is borderline guilty pleasure addictive with a fantastic soundtrack and a unique gun system that combines standard bullets, lasers, and missiles with mounted blades!
The graphics are old-school cool 3D effects from the PS1 era.
The controls are intuitive and responsive with a simple keyboard layout.

... fantastic vertical shmup - old-school-style... responsive, graphics aren't so busy as you can't see what's going on (although it gets there!) and it's tough as nails... nice weapons dynamic... fluid controls... now aim for those high-scores!!

I rate ALLTYNEX Second (I can't figure out the name of this game either), 3.5, It's okay if you like this sort of thing.


This is a fairly exciting bullet hell space action late 1980s styled arcade game which will seem familiar to anyone whos played Crimson Clover or Raiden III. The weapons systems on your spacecraft take a little getting used to but other than that there is nearly no learning curve to this game. However, this game is extremely difficult and can be frustrating at times (like other games in its series).  This game runs adequately although I suffered one computer freeze from this game when turning it off. It's fairly creative and frenetic and exciting but if played more than just casually it can get repetitive and frustrating. Best to get this one on a special Steam sale if you get it.
like!

An excellent 2D shooter with great controls and abilities, plus immersive 2.5D and 3D effects with a solid soundtrack.
One of the few games where you, as the one-vs-all protaganist, actually feel powerful enough take on a whole army.

Also has deep scoring system with replays that will keep you and your friends competing with each other.

At under $10, this game is a total steal.

ALLTYNEX Second is tough as nails shmup in the same series as RefleX and Kamui. If you ever played raystorm on the PSX you probably know vaguely what to expect. This game is very unforgiving and features a mix of shooting and melee with your craft. Much like the others it's an extremely difficult, well crafted shmup that will give you hours of challenge. If you're a fan of the genre I recommend it wholeheartedly. If not, you should probably pass.

Quite possibly the finest shmup ever made. And with gems like Ikaruga, Dodonpachi, Batsugun and Radiant Silvergun around, that's a tall order.

This game gives the shmup formula a kick in the balls in the form of extremely polished action visual and gameplay feedback, with the music to match and a badass laser sword with which you can cut bullets or combo enemies into pieces. All with a healthy serving of anime flair, of course.

Trust me, your jaw will be dropping in regular intervals during the course of the average playthrough.
